title.rendered: “IDF and Security Forces Arrest Six Suspects, Seize Weapons in Overnight Operations: A Review of Recent Anti-Terrorism Efforts”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

IDF soldiers, along with the Shin Bet and the Border Police, worked overnight to arrest six wanted individuals throughout the Central Command.

During the soldiers’ operations in the city of Nablus, a suspect was arrested who had a gun, and later during the operation, the soldiers found and destroyed an explosive device.

In addition, in the village of Tubas in the Jordan Valley Division, a wanted individual was arrested along with military equipment that the forces confiscated.

The detainees have been handed over for further investigation by the security forces, no casualties were reported among our forces.

Since the beginning of the war, approximately 3,000 wanted individuals have been arrested throughout the Judea and Samaria Division and the Jordan Valley Division, over 1,350 of them are associated with the terrorist organization Hamas.
